items.title: US travellers scramble to adjust as hundreds of flights are cancelled over shutdown
items.standfirst: Hundreds of flight cancellations spread across the US on Friday as airlines began complying with the Federal Aviation Administration's unprecedented order to reduce service nationwide because of the government shutdown. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson brings us the latest from Ronald Reagan National Airport in Washington, DC, and speaks to travellers stranded amid the travel chaos.
items.content: Hundreds of flight cancellations spread across the US on Friday as airlines began complying with the Federal Aviation Administration's unprecedented order to reduce service nationwide because of the government shutdown. FRANCE 24's Fraser Jackson brings us the latest from Ronald Reagan National Airport in Washington, DC, and speaks to travellers stranded amid the travel chaos.

items.title: Traveling soon? What the FAA's flight reductions could mean for you
items.standfirst: The FAA is cutting 10% of air traffic at 40 of the nation's busiest airports, canceling hundreds of flights and creating uncertainty for many more passengers. Here's what to do if you're one of them.
items.content: The FAA is cutting 10% of air traffic at 40 of the nation's busiest airports, canceling hundreds of flights and creating uncertainty for many more passengers. Here's what to do if you're one of them.(Image credit: Timothy A. Clary)

clusters.title: Trump gives Hungary one-year exemption from Russian energy sanctions
clusters.neutral_headline: Trump Grants Hungary Sanctions Exemption for Russian Energy

items.title: Trump gives Hungary one-year exemption from Russian energy sanctions
items.standfirst: The opt-out comes despite the US increasing pressure on allies to sever economic ties with Russia.
items.content: The opt-out comes despite the US increasing pressure on allies to sever economic ties with Russia.

items.title: Trump-Orbán meeting: US gives Hungary exemption from sanctions on Russian oil and gas
items.standfirst: US president also praises Hungarian leader’s hardline stance on immigration during friendly White House summitThe US has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from US sanctions on importing oil and gas from Russia, according to a White House official, after Viktor Orbán pressed his case for a reprieve during a meeting with Donald Trump in Washington.Last month, Trump imposed Ukraine-related sanctions on Russian oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft that carried the threat of further sanctions on entities in countries buying oil from them. Continue reading...
items.content: US president also praises Hungarian leader’s hardline stance on immigration during friendly White House summitThe US has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from US sanctions on importing oil and gas from Russia, according to a White House official, after Viktor Orbán pressed his case for a reprieve during a meeting with Donald Trump in Washington.Last month, Trump imposed Ukraine-related sanctions on Russian oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft that carried the threat of further sanctions on entities in countries buying oil from them. Continue reading...

items.title: US grants Hungary one-year exception from sanctions over Russian oil and gas
items.standfirst: Viktor Orbán had a friendly meeting with Donald Trump on Friday to press his case for a reprieve The United States has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from US sanctions for using Russian oil and gas, a White House official said on Friday, after Viktor Orbán pressed his case for a reprieve during a friendly meeting with Donald Trump in Washington.Last month, Trump imposed Ukraine-related sanctions on Russian oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft that carried the threat of further sanctions on entities in countries that buy oil from those firms. Continue reading...
items.content: Viktor Orbán had a friendly meeting with Donald Trump on Friday to press his case for a reprieve The United States has granted Hungary a one-year exemption from US sanctions for using Russian oil and gas, a White House official said on Friday, after Viktor Orbán pressed his case for a reprieve during a friendly meeting with Donald Trump in Washington.Last month, Trump imposed Ukraine-related sanctions on Russian oil companies Lukoil and Rosneft that carried the threat of further sanctions on entities in countries that buy oil from those firms. Continue reading...

items.title: Trump says open to exempting Orban's Hungary from Russia oil sanctions
items.standfirst: US President Donald Trump on Friday said he was looking at a possible exemption for Hungary from sanctions on Russian oil as he hosted his close ally Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban at the White House, citing his country's reliance on energy from the region.
items.content: US President Donald Trump on Friday said he was looking at a possible exemption for Hungary from sanctions on Russian oil as he hosted his close ally Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban at the White House, citing his country's reliance on energy from the region.

items.title: How are US sanctions on Russian oil impacting Hungary?
items.standfirst: Hungary is hoping to seek a waiver on US sanctions on Russian oil as its Prime Minister Viktor Orban is meeting US President Donald Trump. Being his only supporter in Europe, Orban is hoping he will be able to appeal to Trump. But how are the US sanctions impacting Hungary? FRANCE 24's Leela Jacinto looks into it and what brings Turmp and Orban together.
items.content: Hungary is hoping to seek a waiver on US sanctions on Russian oil as its Prime Minister Viktor Orban is meeting US President Donald Trump. Being his only supporter in Europe, Orban is hoping he will be able to appeal to Trump. But how are the US sanctions impacting Hungary? FRANCE 24's Leela Jacinto looks into it and what brings Turmp and Orban together.

items.title: Viktor Orban is meeting Donald Trump as "Orban fatigue" grows at home
items.standfirst: Hungarian leader Viktor Orban is meeting US President Donald Trump in a bid to seek a waiver on US sanctions on Russian oil. With Hungary heavily relying on that resource, getting that waiver would be a way to keep the economy running at a time where Orban's popularity is declining in favour of the opposition. FRANCE 2'4's Philip Turle tells us what's a stake for the Hungarian Prime Minister.
items.content: Hungarian leader Viktor Orban is meeting US President Donald Trump in a bid to seek a waiver on US sanctions on Russian oil. With Hungary heavily relying on that resource, getting that waiver would be a way to keep the economy running at a time where Orban's popularity is declining in favour of the opposition. FRANCE 2'4's Philip Turle tells us what's a stake for the Hungarian Prime Minister.

ai_summary: The US granted Hungary a one-year exemption from sanctions on Russian oil and gas.
This exemption came after Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orbán's meeting with Trump.
Trump signaled openness to the exemption during a meeting with Orbán.
The US has been increasing pressure on allies to sever ties with Russia.
The exemption was granted despite existing sanctions on Russian oil companies.

The fate of SNAP is a key issue in the ongoing government shutdown.

items.title: Turkey issues genocide arrest warrant against Benjamin Netanyahu
items.standfirst: Israeli PM, ministers and army chief accused of crimes against humanity ‘perpetrated systematically’ in GazaTurkey has issued arrest warrants for alleged genocide against the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, and senior officials within his government.Among 37 suspects listed were the Israeli defence minister, Israel Katz, the national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, and the army chief Lt Gen Eyal Zamir, said a statement from the Istanbul prosecutor’s office, which did not publish the complete list. Continue reading...
items.content: Israeli PM, ministers and army chief accused of crimes against humanity ‘perpetrated systematically’ in GazaTurkey has issued arrest warrants for alleged genocide against the Israeli prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, and senior officials within his government.Among 37 suspects listed were the Israeli defence minister, Israel Katz, the national security minister, Itamar Ben-Gvir, and the army chief Lt Gen Eyal Zamir, said a statement from the Istanbul prosecutor’s office, which did not publish the complete list. Continue reading...

clusters.title: At least 54 people injured in explosions at Indonesian school mosque
clusters.neutral_headline: Explosions Injure Dozens at Indonesian School Mosque

items.title: At least 54 people injured in explosions at Indonesian school mosque
items.standfirst: Authorities say suspect is 17-year-old male student and warn against terrorist attack speculation after Jakarta blasts At least 54 people have been injured in explosions that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in the Indonesian capital, Jakarta. Authorities later said the suspect was a 17-year-old male student who had been injured and was undergoing surgery.Witnesses told local television stations that they heard at least two loud blasts at about midday, just as the sermon had started, from inside and outside the mosque at SMA 72, a state high school within a navy compound in Jakarta’s northern Kelapa Gading neighbourhood. Continue reading...
items.content: Authorities say suspect is 17-year-old male student and warn against terrorist attack speculation after Jakarta blasts At least 54 people have been injured in explosions that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in the Indonesian capital, Jakarta. Authorities later said the suspect was a 17-year-old male student who had been injured and was undergoing surgery.Witnesses told local television stations that they heard at least two loud blasts at about midday, just as the sermon had started, from inside and outside the mosque at SMA 72, a state high school within a navy compound in Jakarta’s northern Kelapa Gading neighbourhood. Continue reading...

items.title: Multiple explosions shake a mosque in an Indonesian high school, injuring dozens
items.standfirst: Indonesian authorities said they have identified a 17-year-old boy as the suspected perpetrator of an attack that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in Jakarta.
items.content: Indonesian authorities said they have identified a 17-year-old boy as the suspected perpetrator of an attack that shook a mosque at a high school during Friday prayers in Jakarta.(Image credit: Dita Alangkara)

items.title: More than 50 people injured in blast at mosque in Jakarta school complex
items.standfirst: Authorities say a 17-year-old suspected of causing the explosion during Friday prayers is in surgery.
items.content: Authorities say a 17-year-old suspected of causing the explosion during Friday prayers is in surgery.

ai_summary: Explosions occurred at a mosque in an Indonesian high school.
At least 54 people were injured in the explosions.
Authorities identified a 17-year-old student as the suspect.
The explosions happened during Friday prayers.
Witnesses reported multiple blasts at the school.

items.content: #Typhoon #Kalmaegi has killed at least 5 in #Vietnam, after previously claiming 188 lives in the #Philippines. The storm brought flooding, landslides, and heavy rain continues in parts of the country.

items.title: Sudanese militia group accused of war crimes agrees to a ceasefire
items.standfirst: International mediators broker three-month halt to civil war as further evidence emerges of mass civilian killingsA Sudanese paramilitary group accused of killing thousands of unarmed civilians in an ethnically motivated massacre has agreed to a truce.The Rapid Support Forces (RSF), which is facing mounting criticism over apparent war crimes committed by its fighters in the city of El Fasher last month, said it had agreed to a “humanitarian ceasefire” put forward by the quad countries of the US, Egypt, the UAE and Saudi Arabia. items.title: Paramilitary group accused of killing thousands agrees to a ceasefire proposal after massacre in Sudan
